intro: Julocroton montevidensis var. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan croton, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored foliage. The plant typically features broad, lance-shaped leaves with a waxy texture and vibrant green to yellowish hues. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with moderate sunlight.
